lead_paragraph: The court found blood tests are “significantly more intrusive” than breath tests in a case stemming from laws making it a crime for drunken-driving suspects to refuse either.

headline.print_headline: Justices Require Warrants to Test Blood but Not Breath
headline.main: Warrants Required to Test Blood, but not Breath, Supreme Court Rules

snippet: The court found blood tests are “significantly more intrusive” than breath tests in a case stemming from laws making it a crime for drunken-driving suspects to refuse either.
abstract: Supreme Court rules that police must obtain warrants in order to conduct blood test on motorists  arrested on suspicion of drunken driving; rules further that warrants are not needed in order to conduct breath test.
